questions.question_text: What are two characteristics of VRF-Lite on the Cisco NX-OS platform? (Choose two.)

choices.C: Overlapping IP addresses are permitted on different VRFs.
choices.A: Layer 3 interfaces can belong to multiple VRFs.
choices.D: Interfaces that belong to VRFs can be physical or logical.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CD
VRF can be either physical, such as Ethernet ports, or logical, such as VLAN SVIs, but a Layer 3 interface cannot belong to more than one VRF at any time.
With the VRF-lite feature, the switch supports multiple VRFs in customer edge (CE) switches. VRF-lite allows a service provider to support two or more Virtual Private Networks (VPNs) with overlapping IP addresses using one interface.

questions.question_text:
An engineer must implement an iSCSI storage connectivity in the existing Cisco UCS environment. The environment is based on Cisco UCS С-Series rack server, Cisco Nexus 1000V Series Switches, and VMware ESXi hosts. The implementation must meet these requirements:

• Provide multipathing and high availability in the event of a critical path failure.
• Be cost-effective and not require the purchase of new equipment.

Which two components must be selected to meet these requirements? (Choose two.)

discussion.content: Not sure how pinning or storage binding helps here on multipathing and/or HA... I only have A as the answer so far. Why would it be pinning? How does that help @Wasamela?

Selected Answer: AC
A & B as with the iSCSI adapters on the UCS server and uplink pinning on the ESXi hosts, multipathing and high availability can be provided for iSCSI storage connectivity

questions.question_text:
A network engineer must create a Fibre Channel fabric QoS design for an existing data center. The solution must provide relative bandwidth guarantees to application traffic, control latency, and prioritize application traffic.

Which mechanism must be deployed to support these requirements?

comments.content: good article, I agree will go with D, Traffic classification

discussion.content: The questions is not good... I can't pick A only because that doesn't really guarantee the bw, or prioritize any application.. If anything it should be a combination of bw reservation, classification and shaping. Not sure about this one.

Selected Answer: A
For me, traffic policing. Shaping introduce can introduce delay and it isn't good for FC.

questions.question_text:
A company must introduce a scalable network automation tool to deploy, configure, and manage thousands of network devices and servers. The company servers already have been security-hardened and must not have any additional software installed on them. The security policy mandates the use of a secure communication protocol that supports authentication and encryption for managing the servers.

Which two automation tools must be used to meet these requirements? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AE
Agree with Rick, both are agentless and use protocols such as SSH for secure communication

Selected Answer: AE
First of all Ansible has an Agentless architecture. They do not need any agent at the remote managed device. With this arhitecture, many Cisco devices support Ansible. Chef has an Agent Based Architecture while Puppet has both of them.

Selected Answer: AC
If no additional software can be installed, then A&C are the only possible options. SaltStack has a hybrid mode, where an agent isn't required.

choices.B: Enable clients to pull changes to configuration files.
choices.A: Enable clients to pull changes without installing an agent.
choices.C: Enable one-off infrastructure changes to be performed manually.
choices.D: Immediately push configuration updates to servers.
choices.E: Provide support for writing new modules in Python.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BD
Puppet and Chef use agents.

questions.question_text: Which two automation requirements are met when Puppet is used? (Choose two.)
